build_cumul_dist_for_mc_integration() → None¶

Build cumulative distribution for Monte Carlo integration. From S80 to S85 of the paper, calculation for point 4 in S86

compute_random_ensemble_average_degree() → None¶

compute_random_ensemble_clustering() → None¶

Compute the random ensemble average clustering. S85 of the paper.

compute_random_ensemble_clustering_for_degree_class(in_deg: int, out_deg: int) → float¶

Compute the random ensemble clustering for a given degree class. Point 1-4 after Equation S86 of the paper, inner summation of S85

Parameters:

  • in_deg (int) – The in-degree class.

  • out_deg (int) – The out-degree class.

Returns:

The clustering value for the degree class.

Return type:

float

generate(hidden_variables_filename: str, output_rootname: str = '', theta: List[int] | None = None, save_data: bool = True, save_coordinates: bool = True) → None¶

Generate a directed network using the hidden variables provided in the hidden_variables_filename, and save the data.

Parameters:

  • hidden_variables_filename (str) – The filename of the hidden variables json file.

  • output_rootname (str) – The rootname of the output files. If not provided, the name of the subdirectory containing the hidden variables file is used.

  • theta (List[int], optional) – The theta values for the network. Defaults to None.

  • save_data (bool, optional) – Whether to save the data. Defaults to True.

  • save_coordinates (bool, optional) – Whether to save the coordinates of the nodes. Defaults to True.

Model from Supplementary Information of the paper: Geometric description of clustering in directed networks: Antoine Allard et al.

class Original.infer_parameters.infer_params.DirectedS1Fitter(seed: int = 0, verbose: bool = False, KAPPA_MAX_NB_ITER_CONV: int = 100, EXP_CLUST_NB_INTEGRATION_MC_STEPS: int = 50, NUMERICAL_CONVERGENCE_THRESHOLD_1: float = 0.01, NUMERICAL_CONVERGENCE_THRESHOLD_2: float = 0.01, log_file_path: str = 'logs/DirectedS1Fitter/output.log')¶

Bases: object

fit_from_deg_seq(deg_seq: Tuple[List[float], List[float]], reciprocity: float, average_local_clustering: float, network_name: str = '', verbose: bool = False) → None¶

Fit the model to the network data from a degree sequence, reciprocity, and average local clustering coefficient.

Parameters:

  • deg_seq (Tuple[List[float], List[float]]) – Tuple of two lists of integers/float representing in-degree and out-degree sequences.

  • reciprocity (float) – Reciprocity of the network.

  • average_local_clustering (float) – Average local clustering coefficient of the network.

  • network_name (str) – Name of the network (default = “”).

  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity (default = False).

fit_from_file(filename: str, reciprocity: float, average_local_clustering: float, network_name: str = '', verbose: bool = False) → None¶

Fit the model to the network data from a file.

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – Filename containing the degree sequence.

  • reciprocity (float) – Reciprocity of the network.

  • average_local_clustering (float) – Average local clustering coefficient of the network.

  • network_name (str) – Name of the network (default = “”).

  • verbose (bool) – Verbosity (default = False).

infer_kappas() → None¶

Infer kappa values.

infer_nu() → None¶

Infer the parameter nu.

infer_parameters() → None¶

Infer the parameters beta, mu, nu, and R.

The function performs the following steps: 1. Infer beta. 2. Infer mu given beta. 3. Infer R. 4. Infer kappa given beta and mu. 5. Compute random ensemble average degree. 6. Infer nu. 7. Build cumulative distribution for Monte Carlo integration for clustering. 8. Compute random ensemble clustering. 9. Refine beta (back to step 1) if not converged.

initialize_degrees() → None¶

Initialize the degrees compatible to computation by classes.

The function performs the following steps: - Initialize degree histograms. - Compute average degree. - Classify nodes by their degrees.

modify_log_file_path(log_file_path: str) → None¶

Parameters:

log_file_path (str) – Path to the log file.

Compute the undirected connection probability.

Parameters:

  • kout1kin2 (float) – Product of out-degree of node 1 and in-degree of node 2.

  • kout2kin1 (float) – Product of out-degree of node 2 and in-degree of node 1.

Returns:

Undirected connection probability.
